sen.j: 鷹司 忠冬（たかつかさ ただふゆ、永正6年（1509年） - 天文 (元号)15年4月12日 (旧暦)（1546年5月11日））は、戦国時代 (日本)の公家。
sen.e: Tadafuyu TAKATSUKASA (1509-May 11, 1546) was a kuge (court noble) who lived in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
Tadafuyu TAKATSUKASA (1509 - May 11, 1546) was a Kuge (court noble) who lived during the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
Tadafuyu TAKATSUKASA (1509 - May 21, 1546) was a Kuge (court noble) who lived during the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
His official court rank was Juichii (Junior First Rank) Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor).
His official court rank was Juichii (Junior First Rank) and he held the position of Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor).
sen.cmt: added "and he held the position of" to differentiate between court rank and court position
sen.e: His official court rank was Juichii (Junior First Rank) and he held the position of Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor).

sen.j: 母は正親町三条公治の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Kinharu OGIMACHISANJO.
His mother was a daughter of Kinharu OGIMACHISANJO.
His mother was a daughter of Kinharu OGIMACHISANJO.

sen.j: なお、忠冬には嗣子が無かったため、この忠冬を最後に一時的に鷹司家は断絶しているが、二条晴良の子鷹司信房が織豊期に再興した。
sen.e: In addition, since Tadafuyu had no child, the Takatukasa family was extinguished temporarily after Tadafuyu, but Nobufusa TAKATSUKASA, a son of Haruyoshi NIJO, revived it in the Shokuho period.
The Takatsukasa family temporarily ceased to exist due to Tadafuyu not having an heir, but the son of Haruyoshi NIJO, Nobufusa TAKATSUKASA, revived the family in the Shokuho period.
sen.cmt: eliminated "In addition" since it was awkward; changed "no child" to "not having an heir" for "嗣子が無かった"; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: The Takatsukasa family temporarily ceased to exist due to Tadafuyu not having an heir, but the son of Haruyoshi NIJO, Nobufusa TAKATSUKASA, revived the family in the Shokuho period.
